explains: n. 侮辱；轻蔑；有伤尊严；无礼举动

sentences.en: Prisoners are spared the indignity of wearing uniforms.
sentences.cn: 囚犯们被免于遭受身穿统一服装的侮辱。

sentences.en: The chairman suffered the indignity of being refused admission to the meeting.
sentences.cn: 主席蒙受了被拒于会议之外的侮辱。

sentences.en: The King chafed bitterly over the stupendous indignity thus put upon his royalty, but Hendon was moody and taciturn.
sentences.cn: 国王对他的王权受到的巨大侮辱感到非常愤怒，亨顿更是憋住一肚子气，沉默寡言。
